qas.question: What is the most common application of the concept of pratītyasamutpāda?
What does the scheme of Twelve Nidānas explain?

answers.text: the continuation of the cycle of suffering and rebirth (saṃsāra) in detail.

qas.question: An application of the idea of pratityasamutpada is the scheme of what?

context: The best-known application of the concept of pratītyasamutpāda is <a0_0>the scheme of <a2_0>Twelve Nidānas<a2_0/><a0_0/> (from Pāli "nidāna" meaning "<a3_0>cause, foundation, source or origin<a3_0/>"), which explain <a1_0>the continuation of the cycle of suffering and rebirth (saṃsāra) in detail.<a1_0/>[note 10]
